content.question: A gaseous air‑fuel mixture in a sealed car engine cylinder has an initial volume of <math alttext="600. milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>600.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="1.0 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. To prepare for ignition of the fuel, a piston moves within the cylinder, reducing the volume of the air‑fuel mixture to <math alttext="50. milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at constant temperature. Assuming ideal behavior, what is the new pressure of the air‑fuel mixture?

choices.label: About <math alttext="0.083 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.083</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the initial volume of the gas mixture was 12 times larger than its final volume.

About <math alttext="12 atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the volume of the gas mixture decreased by a factor of 12.

About <math alttext="120. atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>120.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the initial volume of the gas mixture was 120 times larger than its final volume.

About <math alttext="550. atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>550.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the change in the volume of the gas mixture was <math alttext="550. milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>550.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: About <math alttext="12 atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the volume of the gas mixture decreased by a factor of 12.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
